name: Charge
effect: Base; add your Strength base die to the damage dealt on a hit. Your Avoidance is reduced by 2 until the start of your next turn.
weapons: Any melee weapon or unarmed attack

name: Disarm
effect: If you hit, the target must make a Strength saving throw against a DC equal to your attack roll. On a failure, the target drops the item you aimed to disarm.
special: If the target holds the item with two hands or has the Enhanced Strength origin feature, it gains Advantage on the saving throw.
weapons: Any melee weapon or unarmed attack

name: Grab
effect: Target no more than one size larger and within reach becomes grabbed on a hit and cannot move. If your attack exceeds the target's Avoidance by 5 or more, the target is grappled and pinned.
special: May be used as a reaction to catch a falling ally. Includes rules for escape, pin, punish, reverse, and moving a grappled creature.
weapons: Unarmed or melee attack

name: Shove
effect: On a hit, push the target back one area or knock it prone.
special: If the forced movement could cause damage, the target must succeed on a Strength saving throw against your attack roll or move to another adjacent area or fall prone.
weapons: Any melee weapon or unarmed attack

name: Team Attack
action: Ready (triggered by an ally attacking your target)
effect: Base; after the triggering ally hits the target, you may use your reaction to attack the same target. If you hit, combine your damage with the ally's to determine massive damage.
weapons: Any melee weapon, unarmed attack, or attack powers

name: Battlefield Command
effect: Command an ally within range who can hear and see you. As a reaction, they can move up to their full pace. This movement does not provoke attacks of opportunity.
special: Can be used once per scene.
weapons: None

name: Crushing Blow
effect: +1d8; on hit, the target's pace is reduced by half until the end of their next turn.
special: If the target pace is already reduced, they become immobilized instead.
weapons: Any melee weapon or unarmed attack

name: Devastating Attack
effect: +6. Any Zombie of Epsilon level or below struck is instantly destroyed.
special: If hitting a stunned creature, may apply knockback.
weapons: Melee weapons, unarmed attacks, or melee attack powers

name: Double Tap
effect: Roll the ammunition base damage die twice, but only apply your dexterity modifier once. You expend two rounds of ammunition.
weapons: Semi-Auto and Auto-Pistols

name: Duel-Strikes
effect: Base, after you attack with one weapon, you may immediately attack with the other as a bonus action. You may opt to attack the same target twice or two different targets.
weapons: You must wield two melee weapons, one in each hand.

name: Earth Strike
effect: All affected creatures suffer your Strength base die in damage and are knocked back one Area directly away from you; members, if any mobs affected by this power, are also knocked prone.

name: Earth to Sky
effect: When the target of a charge, you may, as a reaction, attempt an opposed attack roll check against your attacker's attack roll. If successful, your opponent's attack misses, and you throw them a number of areas equal to half your throw range. Your opponent then suffers damage as if they had fallen the distance thrown, plus the number of areas your opponent traversed before they reached you. You must be aware of the incoming attack before using this maneuver.

name: Feint
effect: None; if successful, may immediately attack as bonus action with +5 to hit.
weapons: Melee weapons or unarmed attacks

name: Flowing Sand
effect: Base, on hit, you may move one area without provoking attacks of opportunity and then perform another melee attack. You can repeat this attack sequence and move, targeting a maximum number of enemies equal to your rank bonus +1.
weapons: You may perform this maneuver with melee weapons or unarmed attacks.

name: Guarded Attack
effect: Base, Until the beginning of your next turn, you perform your melee attacks without adding your rank bonus to the attack roll but apply your rank bonus to your Avoidance until the beginning of your next turn.

name: Guns Akimbo
effect: Base, after you attack with one handgun, you may immediately attack with the other as a bonus action. You may opt to attack the same target twice or two different targets.
weapons: Must wield two handguns.

name: Headshot
effect: You use your action to set up your next shot, then use your bonus action take your shot. If you hit, you deal your attackâ€™s maximum base damage, expending a single round of ammo if using a firearm. Any Zombie of Epsilon level or below successfully struck with a headshot is instantly destroyed.
weapons: Any Firearm, thrown weapon, archaic missile weapon (such as bows), or ranged single target energy blast power.

name: Inspiring Performance
effect: As a bonus action, you can use your Performance skill to inspire your allies. Perform a Performance (Charisma) check. Choose up to three allies within range who can see or hear you. They gain temporary stamina equal to the result of your roll. You cannot use this ability again until you complete a short or long rest.

name: Lure
effect: Target must attack you next turn with +4 to hit. If miss, may hit another target of your choice.
weapons: Any

name: Murderous Precision
effect: x2. If you successfully use this maneuver on bystander, hardened, or Zeta-ranked threats, they are instantly killed.
weapons: You may perform this maneuver with any melee weapon, unarmed attack, or melee attack powers.

name: Overwhelming Charge
effect: Base, you move up to your full pace and perform a single unarmed attack against all the creatures within a single area; the creatures that are hit must make a dexterity saving throw against a DC equal to that of your attack roll or fall prone.
special: CYour Avoidance is reduced by -4 until the beginning of your next turn.
weapons: You may only perform this maneuver as an unarmed attack.

name: Palm Throw
effect: Attack up to 3 targets. If single target hit with advantage, double weapon base damage dice.
weapons: One-handed thrown weapons (e.g., knives, shuriken)

name: Quick Reflexes
effect: When you are the target of a melee attack, you may use your reaction to give the attacker Disadvantage on their attack roll. You must be aware of the attack before using this maneuver.
special: Can be used once per turn.

name: Quick Strike
effect: Base, when a creature in your area attacks you, you may make a melee attack against your attacker as a reaction. You must be aware of the attack before using this maneuver.
weapons: You may perform this maneuver with any melee weapon, unarmed attack, or melee attack power.

name: Rallying Cry
effect: Once per scene, you may roll your Charisma base die and add double your rank; all allies within 2 areas regain stamina equal to the result. Allies Defeated due to stamina loss gain 1 point of stamina but cannot act until the end of your next turn.

name: Rally the Troops
effect: Once per scene, all allies within range gain temporary stamina equal to your Charisma modifier and Advantage on their next attack roll.

name: Rapid Strikes
effect: Base, on hit, you can make an additional attack against any other target in the same area.
weapons: You may perform this maneuver with any melee weapon, unarmed attack, or melee attack powers.

name: Ricochet Throw
effect: Base, you may throw a blunt weapon to hit multiple targets, which all must be within your throwing range. If you are successful on your first attack roll, you may make an attack roll against another target within range. You may choose a third target within range if you successfully hit that target. Your weapon returns to your hand after the 3rd successful attack or the first miss.
special: When you throw a blunt object, it can Ricochet off solid objects and return to your hand at the end of your turn without requiring a roll.
weapons: You may only perform this maneuver with any one-handed blunt weapon that can be easily thrown.

name: Shielding
effect: Absorb attack meant for nearby target with your body or object.
special: See full rules for using body/object to shield.
weapons: None

name: Shoulder Charge
effect: Base, on a hit, you can force your opponent into an adjacent area or knock them prone (your choice) after which you may move with your opponent into an adjacent area as a reaction. If this forced movement could cause damage (e.g., pushing a zombie into a fire), your target must succeed on a Strength saving throw against a DC equal to your attack roll. On a failure, they move to another adjacent area of their choice or fall prone.
weapons: (Enhanced Strength): If you possess the Enhanced Strength Origins feature, you can send your target flying, throwing them a number of areas equal to half your Strength modifire. If they hit a solid object along their path, both they and the object suffer falling damage as if they fell the distance traveled.

name: Vicious Stab
effect: Base, on hit, you cause the target to bleed, dealing 1d4 damage at the start of their turn for the next 3 turns. This maneuver is ineffective against the undead; bleeding effects can stack with other instances of bleeding.
weapons: You may perform this maneuver with any melee weapon or unarmed attack that deals either slashing or piercing damage.
